trans-unit.source: Launch the default app for a file
trans-unit.target: Launch the default app for a file

trans-unit.source: Learn how to launch the default app for a file.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to launch the default app for a file.

trans-unit.source: Launch the default app for a file
trans-unit.target: Launch the default app for a file

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: Windows.System.Launcher.LaunchFileAsync
trans-unit.target: Windows.System.Launcher.LaunchFileAsync

trans-unit.source: Learn how to launch the default app for a file.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to launch the default app for a file.

trans-unit.source: Many apps need to work with files that they can't handle themselves.
trans-unit.target: Many apps need to work with files that they can't handle themselves.

trans-unit.source: For example, e-mail apps receive a variety of file types and need a way to launch these files in their default handlers.
trans-unit.target: For example, e-mail apps receive a variety of file types and need a way to launch these files in their default handlers.

trans-unit.source: These steps show how to use the [**Windows.System.Launcher**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241801) API to launch the default handler for a file that your app can't handle itself.
trans-unit.target: These steps show how to use the [**Windows.System.Launcher**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241801) API to launch the default handler for a file that your app can't handle itself.

trans-unit.source: Get the file object
trans-unit.target: Get the file object

trans-unit.source: First, get a [**Windows.Storage.StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) object for the file.
trans-unit.target: First, get a [**Windows.Storage.StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) object for the file.

trans-unit.source: If the file is included in the package for your app, you can use the [**Package.InstalledLocation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224681) property to get a [**Windows.Storage.StorageFolder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227230) object and the [**Windows.Storage.StorageFolder.GetFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227272) method to get the [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) object.
trans-unit.target: If the file is included in the package for your app, you can use the [**Package.InstalledLocation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224681) property to get a [**Windows.Storage.StorageFolder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227230) object and the [**Windows.Storage.StorageFolder.GetFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227272) method to get the [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) object.

trans-unit.source: If the file is in a known folder, you can use the properties of the [**Windows.Storage.KnownFolders**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227151) class to get a [**StorageFolder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227230) and the [**GetFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227272) method to get the [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) object.
trans-unit.target: If the file is in a known folder, you can use the properties of the [**Windows.Storage.KnownFolders**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227151) class to get a [**StorageFolder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227230) and the [**GetFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227272) method to get the [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) object.

trans-unit.source: Launch the file
trans-unit.target: Launch the file

trans-unit.source: Windows provides several different options for launching the default handler for a file.
trans-unit.target: Windows provides several different options for launching the default handler for a file.

trans-unit.source: These options are described in this chart and in the sections that follow.
trans-unit.target: These options are described in this chart and in the sections that follow.

trans-unit.source: Option
trans-unit.target: Option

trans-unit.source: Method
trans-unit.target: Method

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Default launch
trans-unit.target: Default launch

trans-unit.source: LaunchFileAsync(IStorageFile)
trans-unit.target: LaunchFileAsync(IStorageFile)

trans-unit.source: Launch the specified file with the default handler.
trans-unit.target: Launch the specified file with the default handler.

trans-unit.source: Open With launch
trans-unit.target: Open With launch

trans-unit.source: LaunchFileAsync(IStorageFile, LauncherOptions)
trans-unit.target: LaunchFileAsync(IStorageFile, LauncherOptions)

trans-unit.source: Launch the specified file letting the user pick the handler through the Open With dialog.
trans-unit.target: Launch the specified file letting the user pick the handler through the Open With dialog.

trans-unit.source: Launch with a recommended app fallback
trans-unit.target: Launch with a recommended app fallback

trans-unit.source: LaunchFileAsync(IStorageFile, LauncherOptions)
trans-unit.target: LaunchFileAsync(IStorageFile, LauncherOptions)

trans-unit.source: Launch the specified file with the default handler.
trans-unit.target: Launch the specified file with the default handler.

trans-unit.source: If no handler is installed on the system, recommend an app in the store to the user.
trans-unit.target: If no handler is installed on the system, recommend an app in the store to the user.

trans-unit.source: Launch with a desired remaining view
trans-unit.target: Launch with a desired remaining view

trans-unit.source: [**LaunchFileAsync(IStorageFile, LauncherOptions)**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701465) (Windows-only)
trans-unit.target: [**LaunchFileAsync(IStorageFile, LauncherOptions)**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701465) (Windows-only)

trans-unit.source: Launch the specified file with the default handler.
trans-unit.target: Launch the specified file with the default handler.

trans-unit.source: Specify a preference to stay on screen after the launch and request a specific window size.
trans-unit.target: Specify a preference to stay on screen after the launch and request a specific window size.

trans-unit.source: **Mobile device family: **[**LauncherOptions.DesiredRemainingView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298314) isn't supported on the mobile device family.
trans-unit.target: **Mobile device family: **[**LauncherOptions.DesiredRemainingView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298314) isn't supported on the mobile device family.

trans-unit.source: Default launch
trans-unit.target: Default launch

trans-unit.source: Call the [**Windows.System.Launcher.LaunchFileAsync(IStorageFile)**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701471) method to launch the default app.
trans-unit.target: Call the [**Windows.System.Launcher.LaunchFileAsync(IStorageFile)**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701471) method to launch the default app.

trans-unit.source: This example uses the [**Windows.Storage.StorageFolder.GetFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227272) method to launch an image file, test.png, that is included in the app package.
trans-unit.target: This example uses the [**Windows.Storage.StorageFolder.GetFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227272) method to launch an image file, test.png, that is included in the app package.

trans-unit.source: Open With launch
trans-unit.target: Open With launch

trans-unit.source: Call the [**Windows.System.Launcher.LaunchFileAsync(IStorageFile, LauncherOptions)**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701465) method with [**LauncherOptions.DisplayApplicationPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701438) set to **true** to launch the app that the user selects from the **Open With** dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Call the [**Windows.System.Launcher.LaunchFileAsync(IStorageFile, LauncherOptions)**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701465) method with [**LauncherOptions.DisplayApplicationPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701438) set to **true** to launch the app that the user selects from the **Open With** dialog box.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you use the **Open With** dialog box when the user may want to select an app other than the default for a particular file.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you use the **Open With** dialog box when the user may want to select an app other than the default for a particular file.

trans-unit.source: For example, if your app allows the user to launch an image file, the default handler will likely be a viewer app.
trans-unit.target: For example, if your app allows the user to launch an image file, the default handler will likely be a viewer app.

trans-unit.source: In some cases, the user may want to edit the image instead of viewing it.
trans-unit.target: In some cases, the user may want to edit the image instead of viewing it.

trans-unit.source: Use the **Open With** option along with an alternative command in the **AppBar** or in a context menu to let the user bring up the **Open With** dialog and select the editor app in these types of scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Use the **Open With** option along with an alternative command in the **AppBar** or in a context menu to let the user bring up the **Open With** dialog and select the editor app in these types of scenarios.

trans-unit.source: the open with dialog for a .png file launch.
trans-unit.target: the open with dialog for a .png file launch.

trans-unit.source: the dialog contains a checkbox which specifies if the user’s choice should be used for all .png files or just this one .png file.
trans-unit.target: the dialog contains a checkbox which specifies if the user’s choice should be used for all .png files or just this one .png file.

trans-unit.source: the dialog contains four app options for launching the file and a ‘more options’ link.
trans-unit.target: the dialog contains four app options for launching the file and a ‘more options’ link.

trans-unit.source: Launch with a recommended app fallback
trans-unit.target: Launch with a recommended app fallback

trans-unit.source: In some cases the user may not have an app installed to handle the file that you are launching.
trans-unit.target: In some cases the user may not have an app installed to handle the file that you are launching.

trans-unit.source: By default, Windows will handle these cases by providing the user with a link to search for an appropriate app on the store.
trans-unit.target: By default, Windows will handle these cases by providing the user with a link to search for an appropriate app on the store.

trans-unit.source: If you would like to give the user a specific recommendation for which app to acquire in this scenario, you may do so by passing that recommendation along with the file that you are launching.
trans-unit.target: If you would like to give the user a specific recommendation for which app to acquire in this scenario, you may do so by passing that recommendation along with the file that you are launching.

trans-unit.source: To do this, call the [**Windows.System.Launcher.launchFileAsync(IStorageFile, LauncherOptions)**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701465) method with [**LauncherOptions.PreferredApplicationPackageFamilyName**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh965482) set to the package family name of the app in the Store that you want to recommend.
trans-unit.target: To do this, call the [**Windows.System.Launcher.launchFileAsync(IStorageFile, LauncherOptions)**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701465) method with [**LauncherOptions.PreferredApplicationPackageFamilyName**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh965482) set to the package family name of the app in the Store that you want to recommend.

trans-unit.source: Then, set the [**LauncherOptions.PreferredApplicationDisplayName**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh965481) to the name of that app.
trans-unit.target: Then, set the [**LauncherOptions.PreferredApplicationDisplayName**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh965481) to the name of that app.

trans-unit.source: Windows will use this information to replace the general option to search for an app in the store with a specific option to acquire the recommended app from the Store.
trans-unit.target: Windows will use this information to replace the general option to search for an app in the store with a specific option to acquire the recommended app from the Store.

trans-unit.source: **Note** You must set both of these options to recommend an app.
trans-unit.target: **Note** You must set both of these options to recommend an app.

trans-unit.source: Setting one without the other will result in a failure.
trans-unit.target: Setting one without the other will result in a failure.

trans-unit.source: the open with dialog for a .contoso file launch.
trans-unit.target: the open with dialog for a .contoso file launch.

trans-unit.source: since .contoso does not have a handler installed on the machine the dialog contains an option with the store icon and text which points the user to the correct handler on the store.
trans-unit.target: since .contoso does not have a handler installed on the machine the dialog contains an option with the store icon and text which points the user to the correct handler on the store.

trans-unit.source: the dialog also contains a ‘more options’ link'.
trans-unit.target: the dialog also contains a ‘more options’ link'.

trans-unit.source: Launch with a Desired Remaining View (Windows-only)
trans-unit.target: Launch with a Desired Remaining View (Windows-only)

trans-unit.source: Source apps that call [**LaunchFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701461) can request that they remain on screen after a file launch.
trans-unit.target: Source apps that call [**LaunchFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701461) can request that they remain on screen after a file launch.

trans-unit.source: By default, Windows attempts to share all available space equally between the source app and the target app that handles the file.
trans-unit.target: By default, Windows attempts to share all available space equally between the source app and the target app that handles the file.

trans-unit.source: Source apps can use the [**DesiredRemainingView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298314) property to indicate to the operating system that they prefer their app window to take up more or less of the available space.
trans-unit.target: Source apps can use the [**DesiredRemainingView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298314) property to indicate to the operating system that they prefer their app window to take up more or less of the available space.

trans-unit.source: **DesiredRemainingView** can also be used to indicate that the source app does not need to remain on screen after the file launch and can be completely replaced by the target app.
trans-unit.target: **DesiredRemainingView** can also be used to indicate that the source app does not need to remain on screen after the file launch and can be completely replaced by the target app.

trans-unit.source: This property only specifies the preferred window size of the calling app.
trans-unit.target: This property only specifies the preferred window size of the calling app.

trans-unit.source: It doesn't specify the behavior of other apps that may happen to also be on screen at the same time.
trans-unit.target: It doesn't specify the behavior of other apps that may happen to also be on screen at the same time.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Windows takes into account multiple different factors when it determines the source app's final window size, for example, the preference of the source app, the number of apps on screen, the screen orientation, and so on.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Windows takes into account multiple different factors when it determines the source app's final window size, for example, the preference of the source app, the number of apps on screen, the screen orientation, and so on.

trans-unit.source: By setting [**DesiredRemainingView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298314), you aren't guaranteed a specific windowing behavior for the source app.
trans-unit.target: By setting [**DesiredRemainingView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298314), you aren't guaranteed a specific windowing behavior for the source app.

trans-unit.source: **Mobile device family: **[**LauncherOptions.DesiredRemainingView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298314) isn't supported on the mobile device family.
trans-unit.target: **Mobile device family: **[**LauncherOptions.DesiredRemainingView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298314) isn't supported on the mobile device family.

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: Your app can't select the app that is launched.
trans-unit.target: Your app can't select the app that is launched.

trans-unit.source: The user determines which app is launched.
trans-unit.target: The user determines which app is launched.

trans-unit.source: The user can select either a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app or a Classic Windows Platform (CWP) app.
trans-unit.target: The user can select either a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app or a Classic Windows Platform (CWP) app.

trans-unit.source: When launching a file, your app must be the foreground app, that is, it must be visible to the user.
trans-unit.target: When launching a file, your app must be the foreground app, that is, it must be visible to the user.

trans-unit.source: This requirement helps ensure that the user remains in control.
trans-unit.target: This requirement helps ensure that the user remains in control.

trans-unit.source: To meet this requirement, make sure that you tie all file launches directly to the UI of your app.
trans-unit.target: To meet this requirement, make sure that you tie all file launches directly to the UI of your app.

trans-unit.source: Most likely, the user must always take some action to initiate a file launch.
trans-unit.target: Most likely, the user must always take some action to initiate a file launch.

trans-unit.source: You can't launch file types that contain code or script if they are executed automatically by the operating system, such as, .exe, .msi, and .js files.
trans-unit.target: You can't launch file types that contain code or script if they are executed automatically by the operating system, such as, .exe, .msi, and .js files.

trans-unit.source: This restriction protects users from potentially malicious files that could modify the operating system.
trans-unit.target: This restriction protects users from potentially malicious files that could modify the operating system.

trans-unit.source: You can use this method to launch file types that can contain script if they are executed by an app that isolates the script, such as, .docx files.
trans-unit.target: You can use this method to launch file types that can contain script if they are executed by an app that isolates the script, such as, .docx files.

trans-unit.source: Apps like Microsoft Word keep the script in .docx files from modifying the operating system.
trans-unit.target: Apps like Microsoft Word keep the script in .docx files from modifying the operating system.

trans-unit.source: If you try to launch a restricted file type, the launch will fail and your error callback will be invoked.
trans-unit.target: If you try to launch a restricted file type, the launch will fail and your error callback will be invoked.

trans-unit.source: If your app handles many different types of files and you expect that you will hit this error, we recommend that you provide a fallback experience to your user.
trans-unit.target: If your app handles many different types of files and you expect that you will hit this error, we recommend that you provide a fallback experience to your user.

trans-unit.source: For example, you could give the user an option to save the file to the desktop, and they could open it there.
trans-unit.target: For example, you could give the user an option to save the file to the desktop, and they could open it there.

trans-unit.source: **Note** This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
trans-unit.target: **Note** This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

trans-unit.source: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the [archived documentation](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132).
trans-unit.target: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the [archived documentation](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132).
